Dear Ms. Clayton:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 9/1/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability and Exit (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have training
in and maintain a current certification in first aid from the
American Heart Association or the American Red Cross or other
institution approved by the department.
One of eight open foster home records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One record did not show documentation of the foster
parent’s first aid certification. This record had a
certificate for a bill for the training but no name on the
certificate.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
4

Three of nineteen updated service plans (USP) reviewed were
not in compliance:
 One USP dated 9/16/20 – 12/14/20 was missing from
MiSACWIS
 One USP dated 1/19/21 – 4/18/21 completed 4/19/21
was one day late
 One USP dated 4/19/21 – 7/17/21 completed 7/19/21
was two days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL INSPECTION JUNE
23, 2020, CAP APPROVED 7/2/20.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 6.30 Supervisory Oversight (Commitment 66).
Supervisors shall meet at least monthly with each assigned
worker to review the status and progress of each case on the
worker’s caseload. Supervisors shall review and approve each
service plan. The plan can be approved only after the supervisor
has a face-to-face meeting with the worker, which can be the
monthly meeting.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of a supervisor/worker face-to face meeting.
 One USP dated 7/14/21 – 8/9/21 had no face- - face
contact between worker and supervisor.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
DHHS Policy Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
FOM 722-08C Caregiver and Birth Parent
Page 2
5

The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required and
indicates that the foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and
agrees to the activities required to meet the needs of the child in
their care.
Signatures must be documented within 30 days.
Of Nineteen service plans reviewed three did not contain the
foster parent/caregiver’s signature.
 One PATP dated 7/14/21 -8/9/21 did not have the birth
parent signature.
 One PATP dated 11/11/20 – 2/8/21 did not have the
foster parent signature.
 One PATP dated 9/16/20 – 12/14/20 was missing the
PATP.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM Renewal INSPECTION DATED
JUNE 23,2020, CAP APPROVED 7/2/20
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
ISEP 4.22 MISACWIS (Commitment 22).
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated child
welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will be the
primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
In various records reviewed, the case records did not show
consistent uploads of all signed and at time unsigned service
plans and or parent agency treatment plan agreements.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
6

The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
